text_preview: Acute asthma exacerbations require prompt recognition and treatment. The severity should be assessed...
full_text: Acute asthma exacerbations require prompt recognition and treatment. The severity should be assessed using clinical parameters including respiratory rate difficulty speaking and oxygen saturation. Mild exacerbations may be managed with bronchodilators alone while severe cases require systemic corticosteroids and close monitoring.

text_preview: Heart murmurs in children require careful evaluation to distinguish innocent from pathologic murmurs...
full_text: Heart murmurs in children require careful evaluation to distinguish innocent from pathologic murmurs. Innocent murmurs are typically soft systolic and change with position or activity. Pathologic murmurs may be associated with symptoms growth failure or abnormal cardiac examination findings.

text_preview: Motor development follows a predictable sequence in healthy children. By 6 months most infants...
full_text: Motor development follows a predictable sequence in healthy children. By 6 months most infants can sit with support and transfer objects between hands. By 12 months walking with assistance and pincer grasp are typically achieved. Delays in motor milestones warrant further evaluation for underlying neurologic or developmental disorders.

text_preview: 3-year-old boy presents with 2 days of cough and wheezing that worsens at night...
full_text: A 3-year-old boy presents with 2 days of cough and wheezing that worsens at night. Mother reports he has had similar episodes in the past triggered by upper respiratory infections. No fever. Taking albuterol inhaler with some improvement.

text_preview: 6-month-old previously healthy infant presents with fever to 39.5C for 12 hours...
full_text: A 6-month-old previously healthy infant presents with fever to 39.5C for 12 hours. Poor feeding and increased fussiness. No cough runny nose vomiting or diarrhea. Parents concerned about serious infection.
